content.description: Climb the slab between the North Arete and the Southeast Arete.
content.location: This is between the North Arete and the Southeast Arete.

content.description: Sit start on the breadloaf crimp rail as per Unnamed 2. Make a move to the jug/crack, but then traverse right along the lip of the overhang face until you join up with North Arete, then top out.
content.location: It is on the face you first see when approaching from the trail.

content.description: Sit start to the left of North Arete. This is a one move wonder. It is fun though.
Sit start with your hands on the slopey rail, find your feet, fire to the vertical seam/crack, and top out.Â There is definitely room for other interesting sit-starts and variations to the slab.
content.location: In the center of the slab on the uphill side of the boulder, sit start with your hands on a faint slopey rail below the obvious horizontal crack.

content.description: Stand start with the slopers and crimpy seam to gain the top of the bulge. Tricky feet. The sit start goes at V6 per Aaron Gerry.
content.location: This is to the left of Moss Garden.

content.description: Sit start, and climb the northwest arete.

Sit start with right hand on arete left hand either on block pinch or rail.  Pull on and throw left using slopers and sharp slot. This climbs essentially starts at the North Arete and climbs left into the unnamed V1-2.
Sit start with your left hand on a pinch on the overhang and your right hand on a jug.
content.location: This ascends the North arete to the left of Cheeseburger.

content.description:
On the face to the left of Meat Ginder, start with your hands in the left-trending crack. Get your feet up onto the moss garden. 

  There is high potential for a much harder sit start (V7 plus) Find a good undercling in the roof near the bulge and move into the left trending crack.
content.location: It is on the face to the left of Meat Grinder.

content.description: Start with your left hand on a lower slopey crimp, your right hand high on the vertical flake/rounded jug, and your right foot on an awkward flat edge below where the flake ends. Move into the starting holds of the stand start.
content.location: This is a sit start variation of Shredded Beef.

content.description: Sit start with both hands matched on the big, right-facing flake/undercling. Make a big move up the right arete, and then go up and left to the "meat hook" hold. Top out at the V-notch above.
content.location: It is on the backside of the boulder if approaching from main trail. Look for the "meat hook" hold.

content.description: Start with your left hand on the "meat hook" and your right hand on the southeast arete. This requires delicate feet and a committing move to the V-notch at the top.
content.location: It is to the left of Southeast Arete.

content.description:
Stand start with your left hand on a sloper and your right hand on the arete/rail. Move up into the rail/arete. The meat hook jug is your first target. Next comes the topout. 

  There is a sit start that would go at a couple grades higher, maybe V6 or V7. (Are you reading this, Pete?)
content.location: This is to the left of Meat Hook.

content.description: Sit start in the small overhang at the southeast arete. Your left hand is on a right-facing vertical rail/hold, and your right hand is on a crimp on the right face. Find good feet, and move into the arete proper using crimps and tricky feet.
content.location: This ascends the Southeast arete of Slanted Boulder.

content.description: This climb adds a hard move or two to the existing climb Hyperion. Sit start with both of your hands underclinging the right-facing flake and your feet on tiny edges. The crux for me is making the big, right hand move to the traditional starting crimp and then flipping your left hand to a gaston on the flake. Make some tough feet adjustments, and enjoy the rest of the climb.
content.location: It is on the back-left side of the boulder if approaching from the main trail.

content.description: Start with high feet, your right hand on the a good sloper on the southeast arete, and your left hand out wide on the crimp below the meat hook. Bump your right hand up the arete, and then throw for the meat hook. Then throw for the top, and top out.

This route starts on lowest set of small crimps down and to the right of the Southeast Arete. Do an almost a laydown start that begins by moving left toward arete to good edge/crimp. Proceed straight up into an easy topout. Hyperion climbs the left side of the arete, Helios climbs the right side.
This may be an open project? This is an even lower sit start variation of Shredded Beef with the initial moves being much more awkward and challenging.
content.location: This is a lower sit start variation of Shredded Beef.

content.description: Climb the face to the left of the northwest arete that looks like a cheesburger or maybe a roast beef sandwhich.
content.location: This is left of the northwest arete.

content.description: Probably one of the nicest boulders in the Fells. Perched on a rock outcropping is a boulder leaning on its side with a small cave. The rock quality is better than the rest of the park, and the perched condition of the block makes for some tricky starts and hard sits.
